entry.def: Republican means relating to a republic. In republican systems of government, power is held by the people or the representatives that they elect.

example.ex: ...the nations that had adopted the republican form of government.

entry.def: In the United States, if someone is Republican, they belong to or support the Republican Party.
entry.tran: (美国)共和党的，支持共和党的

example.ex: Some families have been republican for generations.
example.tran: 有些家庭世代都支持共和党。

entry.def: In Northern Ireland, if someone is Republican, they believe that Northern Ireland should not be ruled by Britain but should become part of the Republic of Ireland.
entry.tran: (支持北爱尔兰脱离英国加入爱尔兰共和国的)共和主义者，共和派

Sentence.sentence: The final legislation might throw a public plan into the competition, but thanks to the fierce opposition of the insurance industry and Republican critics, it might not save much money.
Republicans and insurance industry are strongly opposed to the creation of a public insurance plan.

means.word_mean: 1. an advocate of a republic (usually in opposition to a monarchy)
1. relating to or belonging to the Republican Party;
2. having the supreme power lying in the body of citizens entitled to vote for officers and representatives responsible to them or characteristic of such government;

sentences.sentence: "the United States shall guarantee to every state in this union a republican form of government"- United States Constitution
"so little republican and so much aristocratic sentiment"- Philip Marsh

means: 拥护共和政体者，共和主义者
